ReportSection.name: Applications
ReportSection.ReportItem:
<script type="text/javascript">
                    $("#reportProgress").hide();
                    $(document).ready(function(){
                        $("div.submit").each(function(i, div){
                            $("input[type=button]", div).click(function(){
                                $("#Applications").click();
                            });
                        });
                    });
                </script>
                Below are the available session applications for the 2017 AGE-WELL conference.  Fill in the information for the sessions that you wish to apply, and then 'check' the submit box and press either the 'Submit' or 'Save' button.

ReportItemSet.ReportItem:
Lunch ‘n’ Learn Sessions

Information: AGE-WELL 2017 will feature Workpackage Lunch ‘n’ Learn sessions. These 1 or 2 hour workshops will be offered on a sign up basis to attendees during the registration process, and offered on both conference days from 12PM – 2PM. To apply for a session, please submit a Lunch ‘n’ Learn Outline by June 21, specifying how you would like to structure the workshop. Final selections will be made by July 1, 2017.

Please contact Krystle.wiltshire@uhn.ca for any questions.

Application:

ReportItem.options: WP1 NEEDS-OA|WP2 NEEDS-CG|WP3 TECH-FAI|WP4 TECH-APS|WP5 TECH-DD|WP6 TECH-MCH|WP7 POLICY-TECH|WP8 ETHICS-TECH

ReportItemSet.ReportItem:

ReportItem.options: I would like to apply for this session

ReportItemSet.ReportItem:
Scientific Talks

Information:

Call for Abstracts
Theme: Benefiting Canadian Seniors

This year within the main conference programming 20 scientific talks will be offered across all project programs & crosscutting activity themes (Core Research Projects, CC’s, Catalyst & SIP). Each talk will consist of a 15 minute presentation and 5 minutes for Q&A. Scientific talks are a way to communicate the state of the science in AGE-WELL to a broad group of attendees. Please submit your abstract for consideration by July 21. Abstracts must not exceed 350 words.

Please contact Krystle.wiltshire@uhn.ca for any questions.

Application:

ReportItem.options: 1.1 RRITE|1.2 TUNGSTEN|1.3 OA-INVOLVE|1.4-S2|2.1 INToCARE|2.2 MovIT-PLUS|2.3 CARE-RATE|2.4 ATforCC|2.5-S1 PCOACH|2.6-CAT1 CWiC|2.7-S4|3.1 VIGIL|3.2 CoPILOT|3.3 DIY-AIDE|3.5-S5|3.6-S5|3.7-S5|4.1 CONNECT-TECH|4.2 CONNECT-PLAY|4.3 CONNECT-CREATE|4.4-CAT1 CONNECT-KT|4.6-S3 Lha’hutit’en|4.7-S3 ACCESS-H-INFO|5.1 AMBI-MON|5.2 PRED-FALL|5.3 IIES-PHYS|5.4-CAT1 REACT|5.5-S2 STIM-OAB|5.6-S4|5.7-S4 WELBI|5.8-S5|6.1 MEN-ASSESS|6.2 COG-ASSESS|6.3 PAIN-ASSESS|7.1 PRI-TECH|7.2 DRIVE|7.3 3DHC|7.4-S2|8.1 AT-SELECT|8.2 ADT|8.3 PRIV-SENSE|CC1 K-MOB|CC2 TECH-TRANS|CC3 T-WORK|CC4 TRAIN

ReportItemSet.ReportItem:
Drinks & Demos

Information: This year the Drinks & Demos reception will be held the evening of Tuesday, October 17. Members from across our network including industry and community partners, Board of Directors as well as seniors and caregivers will be present at this event. It will be a great opportunity to show off your work! All AGE-WELL project teams, HQP and/or investigators with a ‘product’ (technology, KM or practice/service 'product') are invited to participate in this event. The only requirement is that you have something to display that will encourage interaction with attendees (e.g. technology demo, website, KM product, toolkit etc.). To claim a spot in this showcase, please complete a brief description of your project name + 100 word abstract by September 22. Be sure to list any equipment, materials, handouts etc. that you will bring and whether you require a table or power etc. We will try our best to accommodate your requests!

Please contact Krystle.wiltshire@uhn.ca for any questions.

ReportItemSet.ReportItem:
HQP Project Poster Sessions

Information: HQP Minute Madness will be replaced with two 90 minute poster sessions, to allow our increased HQP contingent more time to showcase their research. One HQP from each funded AGE-WELL research project (25 Core Research Projects, 12 SIP, 12 Catalyst = 49) is expected to participate in one of the poster sessions. Which HQP will present and whether they present their thesis work or larger project findings is up to Project Leads. Please provide name of presenter and a 100 word abstract about the poster by September 22.

Please contact Krystle.wiltshire@uhn.ca for any questions.

ReportItemSet.ReportItem:
Expanded Poster Session

Information: AGE-WELL 2017 will feature an open poster session for all HQP, Network Investigators, and Project Leads. The poster session will also feature a CC Alley, which will provide an opportunity for projects and workpackages to network with AGE-WELL’s 4 Crosscutting Activity Theme Teams. Please provide name of presenter, poster title and a 100 word abstract about the poster by September 22.

Please contact Krystle.wiltshire@uhn.ca for any questions.
